Students in the 8th grade may be eligible for Oklahoma’s Promise!

The Promise
Upon meeting the program’s requirements, you will earn:
Tuition at an Oklahoma public two-year college or four-year college or university. OR
A portion of tuition to an accredited Oklahoma Private college or university. OR
A portion of tuition for programs that qualify for federal financial aid at public career technology centers.
(The Oklahoma’s Promise scholarship does not cover fees, books, supplies, or room and board.)

Requirements are listed in the pictures. Bethany Hicks with EOSC GEAR UP will be at Shady Point’s Parent/Teacher Conference on September 20th, 2018 from 3:30 pm to 6:00pm. Bring your 2017 Income Tax papers (the final file, not W2s) for assistance on getting enrolled. If you are unable to attend tonight’s conference but would like assistance, please email Bethany Hicks at bhicks2@eosc.edu

PARENTS:

We are trying to fight this latest round of sickness and need your help. In order to prevent the spread of viruses, do not send your students to school with fever. Many of you are treating the students and causing the fever to go down only to have it come back up later while they at school.

If you student has a fever of over 100 degrees we will be notifying the parents and sending them home. We hope you take the time (around 24 hours) to wait before you send them back to school.

Please work with us on this so we can keep the sickness away from the students who are at school and not affected. This also allows your student to fully recover before they return to school.

Thank you for your help.

Parents,

We had campus lockdown this afternoon.

The police informed us about a situation that was happing in town. We instituted a lockdown and keep the students inside the buildings for the some of the afternoon. While there was not actual threat to the district, we felt the students would be safer inside the buildings and not on the playground or the track.

After less than thirty minutes, the district was notified that the situation was under control and we resumed normal operations.

Thank you for you understanding and remember we will always error on the side of safety when dealing with our students.

It is with great honor and pride that I get to inform everyone of the selection of the following students as Graduates of Distinction and Honor Graduates for the 2016-2017 school year. This year we have a record number of students who we will honor with these rewards.

Graduates of Distinction are students who are graduating and have maintained a grade point average of 3.5 or higher for their time at Shady Point. This accomplishment will entitle them to wear red cords with their graduation gown.

2016-2017 Distinguished Graduates
Emma Baker
Kylah Colwell
Kyleh Colwell
Bethany Cruse
Promise Ellis
Logan Gerhard
Trinity Mendez
Alex Wann
Linsey Whisenhunt

Honor Graduates are students who finish with the top three highest grade point averages. This accomplishment will require them to speak at the graduation and entitle them to wear a gold sash and cords with their graduation gown.

Emma Baker, Valedictorian
Trinity Mendez, Salutatorian
Kylah Colwell, Historian
